TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
Hi,

Amazing mod, my KSP is a really interesting collaboration between Krussians and Kamericans now lol!  

Question:  Do any of your station parts count as copulas?  I thought it wise to ask vs trying all of you parts manually.

Thanks!

David

2 hours ago, debaker02 said:

Question:  Do any of your station parts count as copulas?  I thought it wise to ask vs trying all of you parts manually.

Is this question driven by Life Support Mods at all? There are no Cupolas in Tantares at present but that isn't to say you couldn't right yourself a little MM patch that implements the Cupola's Habitation Modifier (I'm guessing its that sort of thing your after?).

3 hours ago, debaker02 said:

Hi,

Amazing mod, my KSP is a really interesting collaboration between Krussians and Kamericans now lol!  

Question:  Do any of your station parts count as copulas?  I thought it wise to ask vs trying all of you parts manually.

1 hour ago, steedcrugeon said:

Is this question driven by Life Support Mods at all? There are no Cupolas in Tantares at present but that isn't to say you couldn't right yourself a little MM patch that implements the Cupola's Habitation Modifier (I'm guessing its that sort of thing your after?).

@debaker02 Sadly not right now, but I have plans for some soon (Just a fun 'end-piece' to the MIR-2 truss parts).
Glad you enjoy the mod.

@steedcrugeon Might also be the stock contracts system 'Add a cupola to the station'. In that case, I am not sure what triggers a part being recognized as a Cupola - Maybe the name, maybe I will have to check the stock part

48 minutes ago, Beale said:

@debaker02 Sadly not right now, but I have plans for some soon (Just a fun 'end-piece' to the MIR-2 truss parts).
Glad you enjoy the mod.

@steedcrugeon Might also be the stock contracts system 'Add a cupola to the station'. In that case, I am not sure what triggers a part being recognized as a Cupola - Maybe the name, maybe I will have to check the stock part  

 

Hi, it was the stock contract thing.  I will probably just cheat complete the contract, I just do not like the look of the stock one with the door.  No worries, thanks for the info.

 

Thanks!

-D

22 hours ago, Beale said:

Nauka is very interesting IRL. If it does fly, I will give it some love in Tantares. 

Since you seem to like Nauka, I thought I might as well put this out there:

Also includes the planned Nodal Module and some power modules based on one of the preliminary designs.

I think I would also enjoy dedicated Nauka parts

On 2017-6-26 at 8:23 PM, Dark_Dragon26 said:

Since you seem to like Nauka, I thought I might as well put this out there:

Also includes the planned Nodal Module and some power modules based on one of the preliminary designs.

I think I would also enjoy dedicated Nauka parts

Man, so cool!

Surprising to see the little Cygnus sneaking in, so cute.
What would you like to see in future?

 

Hot single space stations in your area, looking to meet you!


Yes, these are the NEP truss parts (Correct name?).
They are intended for Mir-2, but also some other uses planned:

  • Cupola Truss
  • Crew Truss (Like Before)
  • Half-length and Hollow Truss

Space Station Eridani
Early in year four.

18 hours ago, Beale said:

Man, so cool!

Surprising to see the little Cygnus sneaking in, so cute.
What would you like to see in future?

Thanks!

Thought you might like the Cygnus comeback.... told you I still found some use for them (especially the Phoenix for my Cygnus 5 replica..... I should probably post a picture of that one too somewhen) 

What would I like to see? Hmm.... probably a dedicated Nauka airlock... I found the small Cygnus to have the most fitting proportions for that task but a real part would be cool, as would the radiator. TKS style thrusters would be sweet too (although they would deviate from the previous Tantares thruster style). Maybe also some more radiator / monoprop tanks for radial attachement? Something along those lines I guess... as for bigger modules I'm not too sure right now.

 

Nice truss parts by the way. Reminds me I still have yet to redo my Mir station since updating to Tantares 5.0. Once I'm not concentrating on that whole airline assessment thing I might acutally come around to do that.

@Fly Angry dare I ask...

It's been over a month now, and I'm sure all of us are drooling over your alternate textures...

You know what I'm hinting at.

8 hours ago, Beale said:

Even more ideas, If I can layer animations on the same part:

Have you considered exploiting the 'allowDeployLimit' in ModuleGenericAnimate, like that used in the Mk3 cargo bay ramp animation? And have it so the full animation for horizontal but restrict it by default, something like this perhaps: 

MODULE
	{
		name = ModuleAnimateGeneric
		animationName = Eridani_Antenna_1_Deploy
		startEventGUIName = Extend
		endEventGUIName = Retract
		actionGUIName = Toggle Antenna
		allowDeployLimit = true
		deployPercent = 80		
	}

Or something like that? and then just have a little greebly animation for the 'ModuleDeployableAntenna' (like maybe a loop animations that spins the Rx part [yellow] inside the antenna dish (still have the original pivot as the pivot point for breakage purposes)?

13 hours ago, Beale said:

 

Oh. My. Is it really what I'm thinking? The IGLA antenna for the TKS? Backwards-folding?

12 hours ago, steedcrugeon said:

Have you considered exploiting the 'allowDeployLimit' in ModuleGenericAnimate, like that used in the Mk3 cargo bay ramp animation? And have it so the full animation for horizontal but restrict it by default, something like this perhaps:

Or something like that? and then just have a little greebly animation for the 'ModuleDeployableAntenna' (like maybe a loop animations that spins the Rx part [yellow] inside the antenna dish (still have the original pivot as the pivot point for breakage purposes)?

6 hours ago, TK-313 said:

Oh. My. Is it really what I'm thinking? The IGLA antenna for the TKS? Backwards-folding?

Yes, this is a little of both I guess?

It allows the antenna to be deployed either on the Soyuz or TKS (Where in each case it would need to unfold with the antenna facing the different direction).

  

Works great!

It is animated with moduleAnimateGeneric on top of the usual antenna module, the moduleAntennaGeneric uses the second animation layer to avoid interfering with the antenna animation.

There's a problem!

After performing the "rotate dish" four or five times, the screen goes black!
If anybody can help me fix this... I would be incredibly grateful and will do something nice for you.
It would be an awesome feature to have and avoids yet more "slight variation" parts.

@Shadowmage Sorry to drag you here, did you have some experience with layered animations or am I losing my memory?

You can grab this experimental part here.

@Beale  I do use layered animations with my parts (multiple animations, each on their own layers) -- however, I use custom animation modules rather than the stock ones, so I'm not sure how/if those function with layered setups.

From my experiences though, as long as the module supports them, multiple animations on a part should work just fine.  It sounds like you have it all setup properly, and I'm not really seeing anything troublesome in the part config.

Have you tried different layers for the secondary animation?  I'm not sure what ModuleDeployableAntenna uses for its default layer -- it may conflict with what you are manually assigning to the secondary animation.  Try something like 10 or 12 (I think 0-15 are valid values).

1 hour ago, Shadowmage said:

@Beale  I do use layered animations with my parts (multiple animations, each on their own layers) -- however, I use custom animation modules rather than the stock ones, so I'm not sure how/if those function with layered setups.

From my experiences though, as long as the module supports them, multiple animations on a part should work just fine.  It sounds like you have it all setup properly, and I'm not really seeing anything troublesome in the part config.

Have you tried different layers for the secondary animation?  I'm not sure what ModuleDeployableAntenna uses for its default layer -- it may conflict with what you are manually assigning to the secondary animation.  Try something like 10 or 12 (I think 0-15 are valid values).

Many thanks for your input, much appreciated  

Nice idea on the default layers, ah unfortunately it breaks the same as I tried a few values.
I did narrow down the issue though, it happens when you play the moduleGenericAnimation at the same time as the antenna animation, I wonder if you can disable one while the other plays...

I might have to look at your custom modules!
It could also be that both animations use the generic animation module, but the the antenna would be always on and would not be subject to aero forces.

To be honest, this can probably wait for mesh switching.
